<algermissen1971@...> =

o communicate with the UBL gang to see if they are

g media types?

> Yes, I asked a while ago (can't find the link right n=
ow). They were not really interested because they said UBL was intended as =
message payload (paraphrasing) and should not contain 'processing intention=
'. I'll try to find the answer later.
>

So how does media type contain pro=
cessing intention?  (Unless they
mean "web" vs "SOAP"? I think they started=
 assuming either typical EDI
transport mechanisms or SOAP.)

>> That would =
be the best route: =A0getting some semi-popular semi-standard
>> organizati=
on to define some standard media types for business.
>
> Yes - Web UBL.... =
WUBL :-)
>
>>
>> Then, whatever variation they define would probably be bet=
ter for REST

prefer my
>> own format.
>
> Yes, they certainly know the nuts and bolts - =
which is probably why UBL enables almost anything :-) However, stripping it=
 down works quite nicely and it is understandable then.
>

Enabling almost =
anything is the curse of EDI standards (of which UBL
is a bastard child), w=
hich makes them fiendishly complex to work with.
 Back in the day, companie=
s used to define subsets.
